page.title: 06HYDE FARM, HYDE LANE
page.content: {Hyde Farm,}inherited by {Mr.Baird}, is 250 years old.It covers 245 acres in 15 fields, mostly of grass.{Hyde Farm is a Dairy farm of 170 cows,1 bull, 3 calves, 25 pigs and 1 sheep dog. There is also one test tube bull calf. 35 litres of milk per week are given by each of the best cows, with 21 litres being the average amount.{ {Mr.Baird } sells 4,000 pints per week, locally and produces 30 gallons of cream weekly. He also sells yogurts which he first buys in. {Mr. Baird} works an average of 12 hours per day, rising at 6 am. He sells wheat, bull calves and barren cows, also pigs, as well as dairy produce. He buys new cattle from Gloucester Market. Products he buys in for the farm are cattle cake, hay and fertilizer. The{ {Hyde Farm Dairy}is on the farm.
